xxl.core.spatial.cursors

Class NestedLoopsJoin

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.cursors.AbstractCursor<E>
      • xxl.core.cursors.joins.NestedLoopsJoin
        • xxl.core.spatial.cursors.NestedLoopsJoin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterator, Cursor

    public class NestedLoopsJoin
extends NestedLoopsJoin
    NestedLoops distance similarity-join for Points. The use-case contains a detailed example for a similarity-join on one or two input Point sets.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NestedLoopsJoin

        public NestedLoopsJoin(Cursor input0,
                       Cursor input1,
                       Function newCursor,
                       Predicate predicate,
                       Function newResult)
        Creates a new NestedLoopsJoin.
        Parameters:
        input0 - the input-Cursor that is traversed in the "outer" loop.
        input1 - the input-Cursor that is traversed in the "inner" loop.
        newCursor - a parameterless function that delivers a new Cursor, when the Cursor input1 cannot be reset, i.e. input1.reset() will cause a UnsupportedOperationException.
        predicate - the Predicate used to determin whether a tuple is a result-tuple
        newResult - a factory-method (Function) that takes two parameters as argument and is invoked on each tuple where the predicate's evaluation result is true, i.e. on each qualifying tuple before it is returned to the caller concerning a call to next().

      • NestedLoopsJoin

        Parameters:

        input1 - the input-Iterator that is traversed in the "inner" loop.
        newCursor - a parameterless function that delivers a new Cursor, when the Cursor input1 cannot be reset, i.e. input1.reset() will cause a UnsupportedOperationException.

      • NestedLoopsJoin

        public NestedLoopsJoin(Cursor input0,
                       Cursor input1)
        Creates a new NestedLoopsJoin. newResult is set to Tuplify.DEFAULT_INSTANCE. Uses OverlapsPredicate.
        Parameters:
        input0 - the input-Cursor that is traversed in the "outer" loop.
        input1 - the input-Cursor that is traversed in the "inner" loop.
